action.action-desc: Mr. Smucker (for himself, Mr. Owens, Mr. Meuser, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, and Mr. Van Orden) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to clarify the clock hour requirements for certain eligible programs under title IV of such Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Clock Hour Program Student Protection Act.

section.header: Clock hour requirements for certain programs of training

subsection.text: Section 481(b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1088(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: An otherwise eligible program that provides a program of training to prepare students for gainful employment in a recognized profession in a State, and for which the number of clock hours of instruction exceeds the minimum number of clock hours of instruction required by such State for training in the recognized profession for which the otherwise eligible program prepares students, shall be determined to be an eligible program under this subsection if the number of clock hours of instruction provided by such otherwise eligible program does not exceed the greater of—

subparagraph.text: 150 percent of the minimum number of clock hours required by such State for training in the recognized profession for which the otherwise eligible program prepares students; or
150 percent of the minimum number of clock hours required by a Federal agency for such training.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act, and shall apply with respect to award year 2024–2025, and each succeeding award year.
